intro: Aspidostigma acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a characteristic known as dioecy. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common trait among members of the spurge family.
